You can create an HangingMan Candlestick Pattern indicator that requires manual update. The following reference table describes the HangingMan constructor.

HangingMan()1/2

            HangingMan QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns.HangingMan (
     string  name
   )

Initializes a new instance of the HangingMan class using the specified name.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.

Return

HangingMan - The new HangingMan indicator object.

HangingMan()2/2

            HangingMan QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns.HangingMan (

Initializes a new instance of the HangingMan class.

This constructor does not take any argument.

HangingMan - The new HangingMan indicator object.

Definition at line 62 of file CandlestickPatterns/HangingMan.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

using QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns;

private HangingMan _hangingman;

// In Initialize()
_hangingman = new HangingMan(name);
_hangingman.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _hangingman, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_hangingman.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _hangingman.Current.Value;
}
from QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns import HangingMan
    
# In Initialize()
self.hangingman = HangingMan(name)
self.hangingman.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.hangingman, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.hangingman.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.hangingman.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

using QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns;
    
private HangingMan _hangingman;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_hangingman = new HangingMan();
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.Bars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _hangingman.Update(data.Bars[symbol]);
}
if (_hangingman.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _hangingman.Current.Value;
}
from QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns import HangingMan
    
# In Initialize()
self.hangingman = HangingMan()
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.Bars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.hangingman.Update(data.Bars[self.symbol])
if self.hangingman.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.hangingman.Current.Value
